explanation: Kotlin is a statically typed programming language that runs on the JVM, Android, and JavaScript.

question_text: What is the file extension for Kotlin files?
How to print Hello World in Kotlin?
What is the entry point of a Kotlin program?
explanation: fun main() { } or fun main(args: Array<String>) { }

question_text: How to declare a variable in Kotlin?
explanation: val for read-only, var for mutable: val name = John; var age = 25

question_text: How to specify variable type explicitly?
explanation: val name: String = John; var age: Int = 25

question_text: What are basic data types in Kotlin?
explanation: Int, Double, Float, Long, Short, Byte, Char, Boolean, String.
Represents 64-bit floating point numbers: val pi: Double = 3.14
Represents true or false: val isTrue: Boolean = true
Represents single character: val grade: Char = 'A'
Represents sequence of characters: val name: String = Kotlin

question_text: What are arithmetic operators in Kotlin?

explanation: Logical AND: true && true returns true
Logical OR: true || false returns true

question_text: How to use if as expression?
explanation: val max = if (a > b) a else b
Kotlin's replacement for switch: when(x) { 1 -> print(one) }
for (item in collection) { } or for (i in 1..5) { }
Creates range: 1..5 creates range from 1 to 5 inclusive
Creates range excluding last: 1 until 5 creates 1..4
Equivalent to void in Java: fun printMessage(): Unit
fun add(a: Int, b: Int) = a + b (no braces, no return keyword)
fun greet(name: String = Guest) - parameter with default value
greet(name = John, message = Hello) - specify parameter names
val numbers = arrayOf(1, 2, 3) or val numbers = arrayOfNulls<Int>(5)

question_text: How to iterate array with for loop?
explanation: for (item in array) { } or for (i in array.indices) { }
Collection of unique elements: val set = setOf(1, 2, 3)
Key-value pairs: val map = mapOf(a to 1, b to 2)

question_text: How to add element to MutableList?
How to remove element from MutableList?
How to convert string to uppercase?
How to convert string to lowercase?
How to check if string contains substring?
What is null safety in Kotlin?
explanation: Variables cannot hold null by default; must use ? to make nullable
val name: String? = null (add ? after type)
name?.length returns null if name is null instead of throwing exception
val length = name?.length ?: 0 (if null, use default value)
name!!.length (throws NullPointerException if name is null)
Blueprint for creating objects: class Person { }

question_text: How to create object from class?

explanation: class Person(val name: String, var age: Int) (declared in class header)
init { } block runs when class is instantiated
data class Person(val name: String, val age: Int) (auto-generates toString(), equals(), hashCode())
class MyClass { companion object { fun create() = MyClass() } } (similar to static in Java)
fun String.customFunction() = this +  extended (add functions to existing classes)
Function that takes function as parameter or returns function: fun operation(x: Int, y: Int, op: (Int, Int) -> Int)
val sum = { x: Int, y: Int -> x + y } (anonymous function)
Single parameter lambda can use it: list.filter { it > 0 }
obj.let { it.doSomething() } (executes block on non-null object)
sealed class Result { class Success : Result() } (restricted class hierarchies)
enum class Color { RED, GREEN, BLUE } (set of named constants)
typealias Name = String (creates alternative name for type)
val (name, age) = person (extracts properties into variables)
val pair = Pair(A, 1) or val pair = A to 1 (stores two values)
val triple = Triple(A, 1, true) (stores three values)

question_text: What is exception handling in Kotlin?
explanation: try { risky code } catch(e: Exception) { handle } finally { cleanup }

question_text: What is try expression in Kotlin?
explanation: val result = try { parseInt(str) } catch(e: Exception) { 0 }
Represents value that never exists (function never returns)
